oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews - Biff Collie - Fan Fair - 1975
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Bob Luman (performer), Archie Campbell (performer), Faron Young (performer), Buck Owens (performer) and Bobbie Sullivan (fan), conducted by Biff Collie at the 1975 Fan Fair hosted in Nashville.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Bob Luman talks about planning to be a professional baseball player in high school -- Luman talks the first time he performed in front of a live audience -- Luman talks about leaving baseball to play music -- Archie Campbell talks about being a disc jockey at WIVK -- Campbell talks about wearing many hats in hits career -- Campbell talks about the first gag he put in Hee Haw -- Buck Owens talks about his gold pants, which look like pajamas -- Owens talks about his gold suit and being recognizable by his fans -- Faron Young does a Hank Snow impression -- Faron Young thanks Biff -- Bobbie Sullivan talks about visiting the fan fair of 1975 and her favorite singer being Carl Smith -- Sullivan talks about her favorite part of Nashville is seeing all the stars and lyrics in todays country music
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Luman, Bob, 1937-1978; Campbell, Archie, 1914-1987; Young, Faron; Owens, Buck, 1929-2006; Fan Fair; Collie, Biff;
